00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * This module provides system/board information obtained by the bootloader.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 156174 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_SYSINFO_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_SYSINFO_H__
00051 
00052 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00053 #include "cvmx-app-init.h"
00054 #include "cvmx-access.h"
00055 #endif
00056 #include "cvmx-coremask.h"
00057 
00058 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00059 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00060 extern "C" {
00061 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 #define OCTEON_SERIAL_LEN 20
00065 /**
00066  * Structure describing application specific information.
00067  * __cvmx_app_init() populates this from the cvmx boot descriptor.
00068  * This structure is private to simple executive applications, so no
00069  * versioning is required.
00070  *
00071  * This structure must be provided with some fields set in order to
00072  * use simple executive functions in other applications (Linux kernel,
00073  * u-boot, etc.)  The cvmx_sysinfo_minimal_initialize() function is
00074  * provided to set the required values in these cases.
00075  *
00076  */
00077 struct cvmx_sysinfo {
00078     /* System wide variables */
00079     uint64_t system_dram_size;
00080                     /**< installed DRAM in system, in bytes */
00081     uint64_t phy_mem_desc_addr;
00082                      /**< Address of the memory descriptor block */
00083 
00084     /* Application image specific variables */
00085     uint64_t stack_top;
00086                  /**< stack top address (virtual) */
00087     uint64_t heap_base;
00088                  /**< heap base address (virtual) */
00089     uint32_t stack_size;
00090                  /**< stack size in bytes */
00091     uint32_t heap_size;
00092                  /**< heap size in bytes */
00093     cvmx_coremask_t core_mask;
00094                  /**< coremask defining cores running application */
00095     uint32_t init_core;
00096                  /**< The initial boot core for this application */
00097     uint64_t exception_base_addr;
00098                        /**< exception base address, as set by bootloader */
00099     uint32_t cpu_clock_hz;
00100                    /**< cpu clock speed in hz */
00101     uint32_t dram_data_rate_hz;
00102                      /**< dram data rate in hz (data rate = 2 * clock rate */
00103 
00104     uint16_t board_type;
00105     uint8_t board_rev_major;
00106     uint8_t board_rev_minor;
00107     uint8_t mac_addr_base[6];
00108     uint8_t mac_addr_count;
00109     char board_serial_number[OCTEON_SERIAL_LEN];
00110     /*
00111      * Several boards support compact flash on the Octeon boot
00112      * bus.  The CF memory spaces may be mapped to different
00113      * addresses on different boards.  These values will be 0 if
00114      * CF is not present.  Note that these addresses are physical
00115      * addresses, and it is up to the application to use the
00116      * proper addressing mode (XKPHYS, KSEG0, etc.)
00117      */
00118     uint64_t compact_flash_common_base_addr;
00119     uint64_t compact_flash_attribute_base_addr;
00120     /*
00121      * Base address of the LED display (as on EBT3000 board) This
00122      * will be 0 if LED display not present.  Note that this
00123      * address is a physical address, and it is up to the
00124      * application to use the proper addressing mode (XKPHYS,
00125      * KSEG0, etc.)
00126      */
00127     uint64_t led_display_base_addr;
00128     uint32_t dfa_ref_clock_hz;
00129                     /**< DFA reference clock in hz (if applicable)*/
00130     uint32_t bootloader_config_flags;
00131                        /**< configuration flags from bootloader */
00132     uint8_t console_uart_num;      /**< Uart number used for console */
00133     uint64_t fdt_addr;                 /**< pointer to device tree */
00134 };
00135 
00136 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00137 typedef struct cvmx_sysinfo cvmx_sysinfo_t;
00138 #endif
00139 
00140 /**
00141  * This function returns the system/board information as obtained
00142  * by the bootloader.
00143  *
00144  *
00145  * @return  Pointer to the boot information structure
00146  *
00147  */
00148 
00149 extern struct cvmx_sysinfo *cvmx_sysinfo_get(void);
00150 
00151 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00152 /* when run on HOST cvmx_get_core_num() is nat applicable,
00153  * so this func as well
00154  */
00155 
00156 /*
00157  * This function determines if the current core is the initial boot core
00158  * for the application, which may not necesarily be the numerically lowest
00159  * core number in the core mask.
00160  * RETURNS 1 if the current core is the initial core for the application,
00161  * -1 on error, and 0 otherwise.
00162  *
00163  * NOTE: Use this function instead of OCTEON_IS_FIRST_CORE() or 
00164  * cvmx_coremask_is_first_core() to protect code sections that
00165  * need to be executted only on one core.
00166  * Also, note that when hotplugging is enabled, the initial core
00167  * will not be allowed to be unplugged, unless the entire application is
00168  * being shut down.
00169  */
00170 static inline int cvmx_is_init_core(void)
00171 {
00172 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_TOOLCHAIN
00173   extern int __octeon_init_core_p;
00174   return __octeon_init_core_p;
00175 #else
00176     struct cvmx_sysinfo * si = cvmx_sysinfo_get();
00177     if( si != NULL )
00178         return si->init_core == cvmx_get_core_num();
00179     else
00180         return -1;
00181 #endif
00182 }
00183 
00184 #endif
00185 
00186 /**
00187  * This function adds the current cpu to sysinfo coremask
00188  *
00189  */
00190 
00191 void cvmx_sysinfo_add_self_to_core_mask(void);
00192 
00193 /**
00194  * This function removes the current cpu to sysinfo coremask
00195  *
00196  */
00197 void cvmx_sysinfo_remove_self_from_core_mask(void);
00198 
00199 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00200 /**
00201  * This function is used in non-simple executive environments (such as Linux kernel, u-boot, etc.)
00202  * to configure the minimal fields that are required to use
00203  * simple executive files directly.
00204  *
00205  * Locking (if required) must be handled outside of this
00206  * function
00207  *
00208  * @param phy_mem_desc_addr
00209  *                   Address of the global physical memory descriptor (bootmem
00210  *                   descriptor)
00211  * @param board_type Octeon board type enumeration
00212  *
00213  * @param board_rev_major
00214  *                   Board major revision
00215  * @param board_rev_minor
00216  *                   Board minor revision
00217  * @param cpu_clock_hz
00218  *                   CPU clock freqency in hertz
00219  *
00220  * @return 0: Failure
00221  *         1: success
00222  */
00223 extern int cvmx_sysinfo_minimal_initialize(uint64_t phy_mem_desc_addr, uint16_t board_type, uint8_t board_rev_major, uint8_t board_rev_minor, uint32_t cpu_clock_hz);
00224 #endif
00225 
00226 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER
00227 /**
00228  * Initialize the sysinfo structure when running on
00229  * Octeon under Linux userspace
00230  */
00231 extern void cvmx_sysinfo_linux_userspace_initialize(void);
00232 #endif

00234 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00235 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00236 }
00237 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00238 #endif
00239 #endif /* __CVMX_SYSINFO_H__ */
